chapter.title: Introducing &DSCL;s
chapter.para: This chapter introduces you to the packaging with &DSCL;s (&DSC;) for short.

section.title: What Are &DSCL;s
section.para: With &DSCL;s, you can concurrently install multiple versions of the same software packages on your system. &DSCL;s do not affect the system versions of the packages installed by the conventional RPM package manager.

listitem.para: &DSCL;s are distributed as a set of several components, which provide their full functionality without overwriting system files.

varlistentry.term: Are designed to avoid conflicts with system files

listitem.para: &DSCL;s make use of a special file system hierarchy to avoid possible conflicts between a single &DSCL; and the base system installation.

varlistentry.term: Require no changes to the RPM package manager

listitem.para: &DSCL; require no changes to the RPM package manager present on the host system.

varlistentry.term: Need only minor changes to the spec file

listitem.para: To convert a conventional package to a single &DSCL;, you only need to make minor changes to the package spec file.

varlistentry.term: Allow you to build a conventional package and a &DSCL; package with a single spec file

listitem.para: With a single spec file, you can build both the conventional package and the &DSCL; package.

varlistentry.term: Allow you to use a spec file from one &DSCL; to build a different &DSCL;

listitem.para: You can use a single spec file from one &DSCL; to build a different &DSCL;.
With &DSCL;'s namespace, all packages that are included in the &DSCL; are uniquely named.

varlistentry.term: Do not conflict with updated packages

listitem.para: &DSCL;'s namespace ensures that updating packages on your system causes no conflicts.
Because one &DSCL; can depend on another, you can define multiple levels of dependencies.

section.title: File System Hierarchy
section.para: The root directory of the &DSCL;s is typically located in the /&OPT;/ directory to avoid possible conflicts between the &DSCL;s and the base system installation.
You can change the location of the root directory by setting the %_scl_prefix macro in the spec file.
Below is a typical layout of the file system hierarchy with two &DSCL;s, &DSCL; 1 and &DSCL; 2:
section.programlisting: &OPT; `-- &RH; |-- &DSCL; 1 | `-- architecture | |-- &DSCL; root directory | `-- &DSCL; scriptlets | `-- &DSCL; 2 `-- architecture |-- &DSCL; root directory `-- &DSCL; scriptlets
section.para: For more information on the &DSCL; scriptlets, refer to .

section.title: &DSCL; Scriptlets
section.para: The &DSCL; scriptlets are simple shell scripts that change the current system environment so that the group of packages in the &DSCL; is preferred over the corresponding group of conventional packages installed on the system.
To utilize the &DSCL; scriptlets, use the scl tool. For more information on scl, refer to .

section.title: Package Layout
section.para: The &DSCL; layout consists of the meta package, which installs a subset of other packages, and a number of the &DSCL; packages, which are installed within the &DSCL; namespace.

section.title: Meta Package
section.para: Each &DSCL; includes a meta package, which installs essential, minimal subset of packages. For example, it can provide the Perl language interpreter, but no Perl extension modules. The &DSCL; also contains a basic file system hierarchy and ships a number of &DSCL; scriptlets. The purpose of the meta package is to make sure that all essential packages in the &DSCL; are properly installed and that it is possible to enable the &DSCL;.

section.para: To get an idea of how a typical &DSCL; meta package looks like, see the following example:
section.programlisting:
%{!?scl:%global scl example} %scl_package %scl
Summary: Package that installs %scl Name: %scl_name Version: 1 Release: 1%{?dist} BuildArch: noarch License: GPLv2+ Requires: %{scl_prefix}less BuildRequires: scl-utils-build
%description This is the main package for %scl Software Collection.
%package runtime Summary: Package that handles %scl Software Collection. Requires: scl-utils
%description runtime Package shipping essential scripts to work with %scl Software Collection.
%package build Summary: Package shipping basic build configuration
%description build Package shipping essential configuration macros to build %scl Software Collection.
%install rm -rf %{buildroot} mkdir -p %{buildroot}%{_scl_scripts}/root cat >> %{buildroot}%{_scl_scripts}/enable << EOF export PATH=%{_bindir}:\$PATH EOF %scl_install
%files
%files runtime %scl_files
%files build %{_root_sysconfdir}/rpm/macros.%{scl}-config
%changelog * Thu Jan 07 2012 John Doe <jdoe@example.com> 1-1 - Initial package

section.title: Packages in the &DSCL; Namespace
section.para: Besides the minimal subset of packages installed by the meta package, the &DSCL; also installs a number of packages that are part of the package collection itself.

listitem.para: The package collection of the &DSCL; can contain a number of packages, which are included in the &DSCL; namespace and relocated to the &DSCL; file system hierarchy.
